author: B.L. van der Waerden
summary: Van der Waerden recommends his assistant Dr. Kurt Strebel, a promising young mathematician and pupil of Nevanlinna, for a fellowship at Princeton beginning autumn 1953. He provides details of Strebel's publications in complex analysis and Riemann surfaces, and requests an application form if the chances are favorable.
title: Requesting Princeton Fellowship for Dr. Strebel
